name: Locanda Ca Zose

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent the second half of our Venice stay at Ca'Zose. It was lovely and very clean. The room felt bigger than it actually was due to the beamed and lofted ceiling. The mini bar was more than reasonable and nice to have available. Our only regret was having to pay $100 to take a watertaxi at 5am to get to the airport. They were very helpful in arranging the taxi for us, I just wish my question had been addressed when booking the reservation via email as I would have booked a hotel on the mainland the last night. It is really nice to stay away from the crowds in this quiet little area.
reviews.title: Great Hotel away from the crowds...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I had a fantastic holiday at Locanda Ca' Zose. It’s situated in the best part of Venice (Accademia), right next to the Basilica di Santa Maria della Salute and the Peggy Guggenheim museum, as well as two handy water bus stops. The rooms are luxurious and spacious and the staff are cheerful and very helpful. I would strongly recommend this beautiful hotel for an enjoyable stay.
reviews.title: A truly fantastic hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was perfection for us. Close enough to easily walk to San Marco and with super-quick access to the Vaporetto, Venice is at your fingertips - BUT: you're somehow also tucked away from the madness of the tourist-throngs, and able to feel like your "Venetian home away from home" is a sancutary of sorts. Add to that the elegantly comfortable rooms and the charming atmosphere of the hotel with the friendly and genuinely helpful stuff and you have absolute perfection.
reviews.title: Great location, beautifully furnished, great atmosphere!

likes.disliked: — No wireless internet - but it wasn't a problem to check email!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: There is nothing to complain about. We were there on a quick weeknd getaway passing for our honeymoon (if we could only have taken a week!) and this hotel more than fulfilled our needs for romance, relaxation, and adventure.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel with great location
Wonderful
reviews.text: Just returned from a short stay at the Ca' Zose. Excellent hotel with friendly and informative staff and central location (one vaparrerto stop from San Marco) could not be bettered.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have highly recommended the hotel to family and friends. Nice room and bath, good breakfast and a location with easy access to vaporetto stop Salute, (3 minute walk, and Accademia, (5 minute walk), close to the Peggy Guggenheim gallery. The staff was very helpful checking plane departure times.
reviews.title: Fabulous location, great accommodation and helpful staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would definitely stay there again. Price was very reasonable.
reviews.title: Loved this place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: What a find! We selected this hotel by looking on google maps, we wanted a room on a small canal. And we were not disappointed. We had a lovely room, overlooking a small canal, perfect for sitting in the late afternoon, sipping a prosecco, watching the activity on the canal, and listening to the strains of Puccini from the store opposite. Magic! The managers and staff of the hotel were all just wonderful, kind, helpful and generous. Great breakfasts too. Dorsoduro is perfect - close to all the action of San Marco, just a short hop in the traghetto - but peaceful and quiet. If we go to Venice again, we will definitely try to stay here again.
reviews.title: cosy hotel with great welcoming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: very nice, cosy, little hotel. True atmosphere.
reviews.title: Great location, friendly & helpful staff, and comfortable rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: We appreciate very much the warm, helpful and friendly welcoming of the owners (2 venitian sisters).
reviews.title: Quiet, tiny, perfect hotel with a great location. My new favorite in Venice.
Very friendly, comfortable and good position
reviews.text: Lovely owners and a good position. We went over easter school holidays so it was quite busy but service was excellent and the breakfast was great, pastries, bread, cereal, fruit, yoghurt, toast, cakes, cappuchino's etc. One of the sisters organised a tour for us and got us a discount as we are students which was fantastic.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all and excellent stay with the only isue being that the bed was two single pushed together and my boyfriend kept falling down the middle during the course of the night but we didnt mention it as it wasnt a huge issue but in future would ask for a propper double. And there definitley will be a future , we plan on returning once we finish our degrees and would certainly stay there again.
reviews.title: Less than impressed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Would give everything 10 out of 10!!.
reviews.title: Great hotel in excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having read the numerous positive reviews, we booked the end of our honeymoon trip with the Ca'Zose in Venice. It took a little while to find - apparently, the sign shown on the front exists only in photos. When we checked in, we asked about the internet that was advertised on their website. We were informed quite rudely that they didn't actually have internet available, and that they really needed to take that off the website. The real highlight was the beds - as with much of Europe, a double consisted of two singles pushed together. This would have been fine if they had been the same height! The shower was tiny, the breakfast unappetizing, and the night staff flat out rude. I can safely say that this was the only place in Italy where we interacted with anything other than friendly, welcoming people.
reviews.title: Great place to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We selected Ca' Zose 4-6 April after reading the Trip Advisor reviews and booked direct with the hotel. It completely lived up to the reviews with friendly and helpful staff and the room was excellent. Breakfast has a good cold buffet. We would stay there again.
reviews.title: A Delightful Experience

likes.disliked: — If I really have to choose something it would be the double bed was two singles joined together.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our third stay at Ca Zose. Several things make this a good place to stay in Venice. Notable in a city engulfed by a sea of tourists is the friendliness and helpfulness not only of the charming sisters who own and run the hotel but of all the staff. The location is particularly good, central but quiet, and the rooms are attractively decorated, always clean, well heated in winter and air conditioned in summer. In an expensive city, it's also particularly good value.
reviews.title: Friendly, reliable, in a good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: I suggest so much this warm and confortable small hotel in a fanfastic place of Venice.
reviews.title: fantastic Venetian Locanda

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You can discovery the wonderful atmosphere of Venetian People, cause the Owner are two Venetian sister, Valentina & Graziella, who can help you anytime and suggest you the really undiscovered Venetian "calle" and local pub "baccari".
reviews.title: Great small family owned hotel near the Guggenheim and Pinault museums.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: excellent view and easy to go everywere in Venice (just in front San Marco square, crossed canal grande by "Gondola bus" as venetian habitant.)
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel: Care, Comfort, Convenience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: enjoy.
reviews.title: adequate, but expensive for the quaility

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Locanda Ca' Zose, located between the Santa Maria della Salute church and the Peggy Guggenheim Museum, occupies a corner of a quite street in a beautiful, upscale area. The room we had was small, but beautifully furnished and sparkling clean. The beds were comfortable, and our our two windows opened onto a quiet courtyard. This hotel is an unbelievable bargain. The sisters, who own and operate the hotel, were extremely helpful with delightful personalities. Watch for Graziella's beautiful jewelry, which she makes herself. Breakfasts were excellent -- great cafe Americano!
reviews.title: A well kept secret no more

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We are a group of friends meeting for a reunion to celebrate a 50th birthday. Locanda Ca' Zose was absolutley perfect, above all well furnished, very clean, warm and welcoming - no hesitation whatsoever in reccommending this super hotel. It's location is great, 2 minutes from the Salute water-bus stop on the entrance to the Grand Canal and even closer the 'Tragetto' gondola crossing to a short walk to St Mark's Square. Unlike most things in Venice it was easy to find, not too far to struggle with suitcases. The staff are very friendly and helpful - hello to Valentina - one of the two sisters who own the Hotel.
reviews.title: Fantastic - we loved it!

likes.liked: — High standard of decoration, furniture, location

reviews.title: A little gem
reviews.text: This is a very special hotel run by two sisters (Valentina and Graziella) who are dedicated to making their guests feel welcome. They speak good English and are a fund of information on local transport, places to eat, attractions etc. The hotel is small, charming and spotlessly clean. It is very well located in a quiet and beatiful area, close to a Vaporetto stop (Salute) on the Grand Canal. This makes it very accessbile to other parts of the City. It is excellent value to money and I will certainly be returning there on my next visit to Venice.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great place with an excellent relation quality/price.
reviews.title: Great place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: Good breakfast, everything is really cleaned, and a very good situation in the great area of Dorsoduro
reviews.title: Charming and low-key

likes.disliked: — Breakfast room was tiny; breakfast could be improved

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Queit, comfortable, and relaxing... I think that really sums it up. The room and bathroom were clean and well appointed, the breakfast was ample, and the staff was always available to answer questions. I would surely go back and stay again!!!
reviews.title: It was so quiet... we really thought we were the only guests!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Ca Zose Hotel is family operated hotel, with the most gracious hospitality. The owners speak English and are most helpful with Venetian Tours, Restaurants and go out of their way to help with special needs. The Hotel is a newly renovated building and is decorated in the most beautiful Venetian style with a view of one of the side canals. There is a room for breakfast in the morning and tea in the afternoon. Most of the pastries are freshly baked. The Hotel is conveniently located to the Guggenheim Museum, the water taxies and walking distance to St. Marco Square.
reviews.title: This is an excelent Hotel in Venice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want a truly Venetian hotel that is full of atmosphere without costing a fortune, Hotel Ca Zose has to be the winner. After several trips to Venice staying in mediocre hotels, we came across this one and have returned many times. Value for money, beautiful rooms, cleanliness and the most delightful owners make a stay in Venice a delightful experience. Returning to the hotel in the quieter Dorsoduro area after a hectic day sight-seeing makes you appreciate another aspect of Venice with its tranquil canals and beautiful buildings although major art galleries are not far away. We have recommended Hotel Ca Zose to many friends and none have been disappointed.
reviews.title: Simply The Best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed on the hotel on February 2010 for the Carnival and I do recommend the hotel.
reviews.title: Perfect place to go with your girlfriend /wife

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: The main reasons are below:
reviews.title: Good location and place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and will all stay again the next time we're in Venice. Dorsoduro, the neighborhood where the hotel is located was perfect for us. We were a quick traghetto ride away from Piazza San Marco and all the big touristy stuff, but we had a peaceful, less touristy place to come back to at night. The place was very clean and comfortable. The beds are firm but not crazy hard like they often are in Mexico. The room was plenty big enough for two. Breakfast was more than we expected. We had heard that Italian breakfasts were croissants and coffee. They had lots of yummy pastries, breads, fruit, an assortment of sliced meats, yogurt, hard-boiled eggs, cereal, juice and cappuccinos. The woman at the front desk was perfectly friendly and helpful. The rooms had stocked mini fridges and the shutters close tight to keep the early morning light out. From room 12 we could look down onto the "road" (pathway) and hear the church bells. The hotel has wi-fi in the lobby for very reasonable rates.
reviews.title: Wonderful little hotel in the perfect area of Venice
Great hotel in a fantastic location!
reviews.text: The traghetto (traw-jet-to) that we took to St Marks is a little known, cheap way to get around. They are two man gondolas that stop at green signs along the grand canal that say "Traghetto". They cost 0.50 to 1 euro per person and go across the canal to the nearest traghetto stop. Also really close to the hotel is the vaporetto which is like a water bus. The hotel is off the salute (sa-loo-tay) stop. We used the vaporetto 3-4 times in 4 days and should have just bought the multi day pass. It can add up fast.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a terrific experience staying at this hotel. The owners/staff were very helpful and friendly. The room was a good size, AC worked perfectly, the bathroom was spotless and modern (good water pressure, lots of hot water). There are drinks in the small fridge that you can purchase for a small fee.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: You can check the internet using the hotel's laptop for a small price- very practical!
reviews.title: So lovely!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was more than adequate (pastries, bread, cold meats, boiled eggs, cereal, juice, coffee, etc.).
reviews.title: Friendly welcome and simple clean accommodation in a good area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 3 nights at Locanda Ca'Zose just last week. We had the double economy room which was quite comfortable and met our needs. The place was very clean. The location couldn't be better - it is really close to the Salute Vaporetto stop and in a nice quiet neighborhood. We took the #1 Vaporetto (which ran every 10 minutes) across the canal every day to San Marco just one stop away (we had a 72 hour pass). Incidentally the Alilaguna airport transfer is next to the San Marco stop so getting from hotel to the airport was very easy too.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay at Locanda Ca'Zose

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast consisted of a variety of small pastries/ tea cakes, cereal, toast, yogurt, juices, fruit and canned peaches. A nice girl made cappuccino for us every morning and kept the pastry shelf stocked.
reviews.title: A lovely, small hotel with a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We felt that this place was very good value, comfortable and extremely convenient - would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Great Little Hotel
Quiet ,clean and comfortable
reviews.text: We stayed at Locanda Ca'Zose for 4 nights from May 9th. The hotel is in a lovely location, very peaceful and yet easily accessible to main tourist locations. There are lots of nice, reasonably priced restaurants in the locality and it's very handy for the Accademia and Guggenheim museums.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Top tip - why pay 80 euros for a gondola when you can cross the Grand Canal by Traghetto just 2 minutes from the hotel for less than 1 euro!
reviews.title: shabby, not chic

description: Our hotel has been restored it is equipped with all comforts, and is located in one of the most elegant and quite area of Venice Accademia/Dorsoduro close to the Peggy Guggenheim Collection,a few steps from the Accademia Bridge and from the Galleria of the Fine Arts, just 100 meters from the local waterbus stop of Salute located in front S.Mark Squareall rooms have ENSUITE BATHROOMS, tv, air conditioning , minibar and safe, wifi ALL OUR HOTEL and ALL THE ROOMS ARE NON SMOKER as by italian lawsCHECK IN TIME 14:00 p.m.CHECK OUT TIME: 10:00 a.m.BREAKFAST FROM 8:00 a.m.TO 10:00 a.m.CHILDREN OVER 2 YEARS OF AGE PAY AS ADULT.
